I fear for what the impeachment of this President might do to an already deeply divided nation, but I fear more the notion that any President can be above the law. As the inquiry moves forward, we must reject blind partisanship and continue to follow the facts.

However, when I came to Congress, I also swore an oath to defend the constitution and the rule of law. As evidence of the President’s misconduct continues to mount, it is clear Congress must continue the impeachment inquiry and why I voted for that today.

When I came to Congress, the last thing on my mind was the impeachment of the President of this country. Anyone who is joyful over the potential impeachment of President Trump is extraordinarily engaged in wrong-headed thinking. https://www.nytimes.com/2019/10/31/us/politics/house-impeachment-vote.html?action=click&module=Top%20Stories&pgtype=Homepage …

This is an issue that will impact every American and every industry in our economy. If we continue our failure to address this crisis, the economic consequences will be devastating across the nation. That’s why we need #ClimateActionNow

Just last month, I held a hearing on the macroeconomic effects of #ClimateChange, and the warnings we heard from experts were similarly alarming. Labor force displacement, rising sea levels, & decreased crop yields are just a few byproducts of a rapidly warming planet.

“A set of assumptions & practices in economics has led economists both to underestimate the economic impact of many climate risks & to miss some of them entirely.”
 
#ClimateChange already costs taxpayers billions, & we may be underestimating future costs. https://www.nytimes.com/2019/10/23/opinion/climate-change-costs.html?smtyp=cur&smid=tw-nytimes …

I had the privilege and honor of calling Elijah my friend and I will miss him dearly. The City of Baltimore took a hit; The Democratic Caucus took a hit; Black America took a hit this morning.

Elijah will be remembered as a model of courage. As defined by the life of Elijah Cummings, courage was showing up and doing his job when there was little strength to do anything more than just showing up.
He was a kind and genuine man that fought every day to improve the lives of the American people, especially the most vulnerable among us.

The City of Baltimore and the people of this nation awake today to the loss of a giant amongst men. Elijah Cummings was a defender of democracy, a champion of human rights, and an unwavering advocate for equality. pic.twitter.com/oGKM1FdJlb

You’re not alone.

Whether it’s anxiety, depression, or any other mental illness, it’s critical that we destigmatize and educate individuals on mental health.
